ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Running schools in remote area with hostel today many village in kanchanpur sub-division where 1st matriculate student comes out from our schools. And many student today got graduation,post graduation, B.Tech and M.B.B.S also. Many students are ready to start private school in their village as there is no schools for primary education. By girls hostel we have seen that village girls are coming out for study and gradually developing and getting job in various sector (private and govt.)

sourceOfFunds.purpose: This grant is sanctioning for S T boarding house student. By this grant student can continue their study. Normally village student stop their study in village only. Due to poor condition guardians are unable to continue their spouse education more. But after getting this opportunity village students ( boys and girls) are coming out and continuing their study. If govt think more about it specially girls student it will be very much helpful for the society. They will be develop and village also.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Organized fourth Mukul Dance and Music Festival for Children including a ten days long free workshop for underprivileged children. sourceOfFunds.purpose: Ogranized the grand programme Prayati with support from Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi, SNA North East Centre, Guwahati and SNA Documentation Centre Agartala. The grand programme included a four days long first ever national workshop on Bharatanatyam in Tripura which was conducted by Padma Bhushan Professor CV Chandrasekhar. Organised Prayati with full support from Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi, SNA North East Centre, Guwahati and SNA Documentation Centre, Agartala where, ninety percent of the programme budget was sponsored by SNA and the rest ten percent was invested personally by the NGO itself. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: In 1991, at the initiative of a few cultural lovers and some theatre lovers , Sayak Cultural Organisation has established as one of the prominent cultural organization in the Dhalai dist. as well as the region. Sayak cultural Organisation Registered under society act XXI of 1960. No- 3284 of 1999. The main objective of the cultural Organisation SAYAK is to develop culture all round in the true sense of the term. To innovate new & various lines of thinking to make Drama a true mirror of real life with all its hues & odds. To spread drama all over in order to have an united voices against ills of the society. SAYAK WINGS Sayak has several activity wings: a. Organizing cultural programmed and various cultural Competitions. b. Organizing Drama Festival. c. Organizing School level Drama Competition. d. Conducting Drama Workshop in collaboration with NSD. e. Conducting Youth Theatre Workshop in collaboration with Kamalpur Nagar Panchayet & ICAT. f. Publication of Cultural Magazine, Bulletin. g. Working with Children/ Student of Slum areas. h. Conducting cultural show on Bengali New Year. i. Legal Awareness Camp with the help of Sub-Divisional Legal Service Committee. NEZCC assisted Swachh Bharat Abhijan Scheme was implemented in the year of 2017, in order to aware people of cleanliness of urban as well as rural locality of Agartala.

A grant is applied for the observation of 25 years celebration of Shilpatirtha to NCZCC, Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India under the "Cultural Function and production Grant Sceme(CFPGS) in the financial year 2018-2019 and sanctioned in the financial year 2019-2020.
A open air theatre show was held on 12th of may in Agartala of duration 20 minutes, Shilpatirtha performed there the play "bees saal baad".

The project sent to SNA for the grant of the performance of a drama in five districts of Tripura in 2018-2019, however the grant was released at 2019-2020 financial year. As par the regulations 75% of the grant i.e Rs.30000.00 was released and adjustment were made on the released grant only. The rest i.e Rs.10,000.00 will be shown the next audit report once it will release.
Department of ICA, Govt. of Tripura organized Theatre festival, where Shilpatirtha was invited to participate. The play "Keep Silence" was staged at Najrul Kalakhetra, Agartala.
The program was an awareness program on different issues like Corona Virus, Save girl child at five different places of Agartala which was funded by NHM, Govt of Tripura.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Background 1. Bishnupriya Manipuri is one of the two primary clans of Manipuri, the other being the Meitei Manipuri. Bishnupriya Manipuries believe that during the ancient days, their forefathers, fled from the then princely state of Manipur, for safe shelter to the neighboring states in small groups. Despite displaced, they maintained their rich cultural heritage, in their splintered settlements. To bring the Cultural Revolution, the novel laureate Rabindranath Thakur picked a number of cultural artistes of this community as Instructors in Manipuri dance at Shanti Niketan, It includes (a) Guru Rajkumar Senarik Singha (b) Guru Mahim Chandra Singha (c) Guru Bihari Singha (d) Guru Nileswar Mukherjee (e) Pt. Nila Madhab Singha and (f) Guru Bipin Singha. The world famous Manipuri dancer Javeri Sisters and Dr. Tamanna Rehaman are nurtured by Guru Bipin Singha. The name of Professor Guru Banamali Sinha (Retd), Bhatkhande Nrittya Kala Academy Lucknow, comes foremost, among the world famous cultural artistes of Bishnupriya Manipuri. 2. With population of not even a lac, the backward, microscopic minority community Bishnupriya Manipuri remained unnoticed and unattended even after seventy years of our Independence. The world-class culture, language, dresses & literature of the community is pacing rapidly towards its extinct. Formation of SCSBM 3. Alarmed by the rapid pace at which the community of Bishnupriya Manipuri is advancing towards its ultimate extinction, the Socio Cultural Society of Bishnupriya Manipuri (SCSBM) was formed in a General Meeting of the people of Bishnupriya Manipuri at Agartala, Tripura, on 29 April 2012. Major Activities 4. In the Second Annual Function two days Seminar cum Cultural Function was organized on 14th and 15th Feb 2015. The Honorable Chief Minister and the Honorable Cultural Minister, Government of Tripura attended the function. 5. The Cultural Institute of Bishnupriya Manipuri (CIBM) inaugurated at Agartala by Dr. Prafullajit Sinha, the Honorable Mayor, Agartala Municipal Corporation on 14th Feb 2015. 6. The Unique and Maiden Cultural Procession of Bishnupriya Manipuri marched through the main roads of Agartala, on 15th Feb 2015. 7. The Annual souvenir of SCSBM The Heritage of Bishnupriya Manipuri was released by the Honorable Chief Minister of Tripura on 15th Feb 2015. 8. The web-site of SCSBM www.scsbm.org was launched by the Honorable Chief Minister of Tripura on 15th Feb 2015. 9. The title of Guru conferred to four eminent cultural artistes of different disciplines of the community of Bishnupriya Manipuri. 10. A warm Reception to Justice Bhabani Prasad Singha, Judge, High Court Division of Supreme Court of Republic of Bangladesh, was given on 22 March 2015. 11. A Seminar of Cultural Artistes of Bishnupriya Manipuri was conducted on 20th September 2015. Among others Sri R Ganguly, Director Sangeet Natak Academy North East Centre, Agartala was present in the function. 12. Established five (05) Branch Offices at Bishnupriya Manipuri populated areas. 13. The Third Annual Function held on 13 March 2016. 14. Accounts audited for the Financial Year (a) 2012- 13 (b) 2013-14 (c) 2014-15 and (d) 2015-16. 15. For details visit â€“ www.scsbm.org .
